org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.messaging

Class ResponseCounter<RESPONSE_TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.messaging.ResponseCounter<RESPONSE_TYPE>
  • Type Parameters:
    RESPONSE_TYPE - The type of the response to be given when all outstanding requests have been completed.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>

    public class ResponseCounter<RESPONSE_TYPE>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>
    When multiple requests have been sent, ResponseCounter can be used to track the number of requests that have not yet completed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean active
      True when there are still incomplete requests.
      private int count
      The number of requests that have not yet completed.
      private RESPONSE_TYPE result
      The response to be returned when all the requests have completed.
      private ResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE> rp
      The ResponseProcessor to be used when all outstanding requests have completed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResponseCounter(int _count, RESPONSE_TYPE response, ResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE> _rp)
      Create a ResponseCounter.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decrementCount()
      When an ExceptionHandler has caught an exception from one of the outstanding requests, decrementCount needs to be called.
      int getCount()
      Returns the number of outstanding requests remaining.
      void incrementCount()
      When an additional request has been sent, incrementCount needs to be called.
      void processResponse(RESPONSE_TYPE response)
      The processResponse method accepts the response of a request.
      void setResult(RESPONSE_TYPE _result)
      The setResult method can be used to change the result to be given when all outstanding requests have completed.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • processResponse

        public void processResponse(RESPONSE_TYPE response)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ResponseProcessor
        The processResponse method accepts the response of a request.

        This method need not be thread-safe, as it is always invoked from the same light-weight thread (message processor) that passed the Request and ResponseProcessor objects.

        Specified by:
        processResponse in interface ResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Parameters:
        response - The response to a request.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
